The Defence Cannot Argue

Key Evidence

Landmark Vindication Findings

The most significant independent clinical conclusions

KEY
F030
Clinical

Dr Gorrie Removes Somatoform Diagnosis

"there were clear causes for his pain."

Marked the Somatoform Pain Disorder diagnosis as INACTIVE. Highly unusual to remove without formal psychiatric reassessment - the error was self-evident.

Dr Alexander Gorrie (GP)

Current Practice

22 July 2025

View finding details
KEY
F038
Clinical

Psychiatric Assessment Clearance

NO: PTSD, depression, psychosis, personality disorder, OR somatisation disorder

Formal psychiatric assessment found no psychiatric disorders. Presentation consistent with inadequately treated physical illness.

Dr Gupta

NHS Mental Health Services

2023

View finding details
KEY
F036
Imaging

US Doppler - Bilateral Subclavian Occlusion

At 90° abduction, subclavian veins "compressed with no flow"

Dynamic vascular compression demonstrated with positional occlusion. Both arms show flow cessation in provocative positions.

Vascular Team

Royal Free Hospital

9 June 2025

View finding details

F031
Clinical

Pain Clinic Refutes Somatoform

"GP prev told somatic, pain clinic at C&W; felt not somatic."

Pain Clinic explicitly disagreed with somatoform characterisation.

C&W Pain Clinic

Chelsea & Westminster Hospital

2023

F038

Psychiatric Assessment Clearance

NO: PTSD, depression, psychosis, personality disorder, OR somatisation disorder

F032
Imaging

2019 Duplex Ultrasound - TOS Positive

"Marked haemodynamic changes... a positive result."

Complete cessation of flow within the distal subclavian artery during Adson's and EAST manoeuvres bilaterally.

Vascular Sonographer

Royal Free Hospital

13 June 2019

View finding details
F033
Imaging

2024 UCLH MR - Dynamic Subclavian Compression

Compression of the left subclavian artery and vein in the subclavicular space with arms abducted

MR thoracic inlet/outlet report describes compression including apparent focal stenosis.

Dr An Thanh Ngo

UCLH

10 January 2024

View finding details
KEY
F036
Imaging

US Doppler - Bilateral Subclavian Occlusion

At 90° abduction, subclavian veins "compressed with no flow"

Dynamic vascular compression demonstrated with positional occlusion. Both arms show flow cessation in provocative positions.

Vascular Team

Royal Free Hospital

9 June 2025

View finding details
F037
Imaging

CT Aorta - TOS Not Excluded

"A thoracic outlet syndrome affecting left subclavian artery cannot be excluded"

Arms-down study shows no stenosis but radiologist explicitly states TOS cannot be excluded without dynamic study.

Consultant Radiologist

UCLH

16 April 2024

View finding details
F034
Clinical

Dr Gorrie Recognises 2021 Seizure/Fractures

History of tonic-clonic seizure in 2021 with rib injury... pain was not investigated properly

First GP to properly recognise and act on injury pattern - what previous GPs dismissed for nearly 2 years.

Dr Alexander Gorrie

Current Practice

17 October 2023

View finding details
F354
Clinical

Formal Epilepsy Diagnosis Confirmed

Epilepsy formally diagnosed

Formal diagnosis validates all prior seizure events as genuine neurological episodes.

Neurology Team

Imperial College Healthcare

December 2024

View finding details

Independent Clinical Vindication

Every vindication finding comes from NHS clinicians with no prior involvement in the case. They independently examined the patient, reviewed the evidence, and reached conclusions that contradict the psychiatric dismissal narrative applied by the former GP practice.
